questions.text: Which of the following best describes the distribution of valence electrons in an electrical conductor?

answerChoices.text: Each valence electron is shared between exactly two atoms.
There are no valence electrons in an electrical conductor.
Each atom holds its valence electrons individually.
Valence electrons are arranged in a grid pattern.

questions.text: Which of the following statements best describes the distribution of nuclei in an electrical conductor?

answerChoices.text: Nuclei are fixed in place in a grid pattern.
Nuclei are fixed in place in a random pattern.
Nuclei follow no set pattern in an electric conductor.
